meaningMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it probably uses the kun'yomi reading. You did not learn this reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

It turns out she is a <vocabulary>fake</vocabulary>. Your <reading>niece</reading> (にせ) was a robot this whole time, just pretending to be your niece. What is wrong with this world, where your niece can be an <vocabulary>imitation</vocabulary> niece. A 偽niece, if you will.
